title: 'I'm stepping away because ... ': Why Mira Murati quit as CTO Of OpenAI
content: Mira Murati has decided to resign from her role as chief technology officer at OpenAI to focus on personal exploration. CEO Sam Altman expressed his gratitude for her contributions. Additionally, two other top executives, Bob McGrew and Barret Zoph, are also leaving the company independently and amicably, according to Altman.
summary: Mira Murati has decided to resign from her role as chief technology officer at OpenAI to focus on personal exploration. CEO Sam Altman expressed his gratitude for her contributions. Additionally, two other top executives, Bob McGrew and Barret Zoph, are also leaving the company independently and amicably, according to Altman.

title: Jhumpa Lahiri declines a Noguchi Museum Award over a ban on kaffiyehs
content: Pulitzer Prize-winning author Jhumpa Lahiri has turned down an award from the Noguchi Museum in Queens over its new ban on political attire for staff, leading to the dismissal of three employees who wore kaffiyehs. The museum defends this policy as necessary to avoid alienating visitors, despite significant staff opposition.
summary: Pulitzer Prize-winning author Jhumpa Lahiri has turned down an award from the Noguchi Museum in Queens over its new ban on political attire for staff, leading to the dismissal of three employees who wore kaffiyehs. The museum defends this policy as necessary to avoid alienating visitors, despite significant staff opposition.

title: Yunus rules out running in poll, says Hasina must be extradited
Top Republican wants Ukrainian ambassador to US fired, ahead of Zelenskyy visit
content: Republican leaders have expressed anger over Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's visit to an ammunition plant in Pennsylvania, a crucial swing state. Former President Trump criticized Zelenskiy for not negotiating with Russia. The House Oversight Committee will investigate if the visit was aimed at aiding Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign efforts.
summary: Republican leaders have expressed anger over Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's visit to an ammunition plant in Pennsylvania, a crucial swing state. Former President Trump criticized Zelenskiy for not negotiating with Russia. The House Oversight Committee will investigate if the visit was aimed at aiding Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign efforts.

title: 'To keep government open': What is stopgap spending bill signed by Joe Biden
content: Joe Biden signed a stopgap spending bill to avert an immediate government shutdown, keeping the US government operational until mid-December. The bill maintains current funding levels for agencies and provides additional funds for the Secret Service. Biden highlighted support for national defense, veterans, and working families while opposing IRS budget cuts targeting wealthy tax evaders.
summary: Joe Biden signed a stopgap spending bill to avert an immediate government shutdown, keeping the US government operational until mid-December. The bill maintains current funding levels for agencies and provides additional funds for the Secret Service. Biden highlighted support for national defense, veterans, and working families while opposing IRS budget cuts targeting wealthy tax evaders.

title: California apologizes for slavery, its effects on Black Americans
content: California Governor Gavin Newsom signed a law formally apologizing for slavery and its effects on Black Americans. This is part of a series of reparations bills aimed at addressing racial disparities. Although no direct payment legislation was passed, Newsom approved a budget with up to $12 million for reparations legislation.
summary: California Governor Gavin Newsom signed a law formally apologizing for slavery and its effects on Black Americans. This is part of a series of reparations bills aimed at addressing racial disparities. Although no direct payment legislation was passed, Newsom approved a budget with up to $12 million for reparations legislation.

title: At least 1 child killed, 25 cops injured in Pakistan police station blast
content: An explosion at a police station in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province has led to the death of one child and injuries to 25 people, primarily police officers. The blast is believed to have been caused by a short circuit. Rescue efforts are ongoing, with injured individuals transported to the district headquarters hospital for medical care.
summary: An explosion at a police station in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province has led to the death of one child and injuries to 25 people, primarily police officers. The blast is believed to have been caused by a short circuit. Rescue efforts are ongoing, with injured individuals transported to the district headquarters hospital for medical care.

title: ‘Ukraine will win this war’: Biden to Zelenskyy while discussing victory plan in war with Russia
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with US President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris to discuss Ukraine's Victory Plan as the war with Russia continues. Zelenskyy expressed gratitude for US support, while Biden reiterated America's commitment. The meeting followed an announcement of a new $8 billion aid package for Ukraine.
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with US President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris to discuss Ukraine's Victory Plan as the war with Russia continues. Zelenskyy expressed gratitude for US support, while Biden reiterated America's commitment. The meeting followed an announcement of a new $8 billion aid package for Ukraine.

title: 'Parents accountable for ... ': What is new gun law signed by Joe Biden targeting active shooter drills in schools
content: President Joe Biden has signed an executive order aimed at reducing gun violence by targeting 3D-printed guns and machine guns. The order calls for universal background checks, safe firearm storage, and improved active shooter drills in schools. Vice President Kamala Harris stressed the need to reinstate the assault weapons ban during her first gun-related event with Biden.
summary: President Joe Biden has signed an executive order aimed at reducing gun violence by targeting 3D-printed guns and machine guns. The order calls for universal background checks, safe firearm storage, and improved active shooter drills in schools. Vice President Kamala Harris stressed the need to reinstate the assault weapons ban during her first gun-related event with Biden.

title: Sleepless in Kyiv: Ukraine faces constant drone attacks
content: Kyiv endured another night of air raid alerts and drone attacks, leading to explosions across various districts. Residents often take refuge in bomb shelters, with children and the elderly particularly affected. Ukrainian air defense forces work tirelessly to intercept drones as the city continues to hope for an end to these nightly disruptions.
summary: Kyiv endured another night of air raid alerts and drone attacks, leading to explosions across various districts. Residents often take refuge in bomb shelters, with children and the elderly particularly affected. Ukrainian air defense forces work tirelessly to intercept drones as the city continues to hope for an end to these nightly disruptions.

title: Chinese doctor banned for three years after woman dies following herbal tea treatment
content: Dr Shuquan Liu, a Chinese medical practitioner in Australia, has been banned from practising for three years after prescribing herbal tea to a woman with heart issues, who later died. The tribunal found him guilty of professional misconduct for failing to gather sufficient information before administering the treatment.
summary: Dr Shuquan Liu, a Chinese medical practitioner in Australia, has been banned from practising for three years after prescribing herbal tea to a woman with heart issues, who later died. The tribunal found him guilty of professional misconduct for failing to gather sufficient information before administering the treatment.

title: Hezbollah’s aerial commander Muhammad Hussein Srour reportedly killed by IAF
content: The Israeli Air Force has reportedly eliminated Muhammad Hussein Srour, the commander of Hezbollah’s Aerial Command, in a precise strike in Beirut. Linked to numerous aerial terrorist operations and UAV production near civilian areas, his death marks a significant blow to Hezbollah's capabilities and their recent activities against Israeli civilians and soldiers.
summary: The Israeli Air Force has reportedly eliminated Muhammad Hussein Srour, the commander of Hezbollah’s Aerial Command, in a precise strike in Beirut. Linked to numerous aerial terrorist operations and UAV production near civilian areas, his death marks a significant blow to Hezbollah's capabilities and their recent activities against Israeli civilians and soldiers.

title: Kamala Harris' climate advocacy questioned as presidential campaign racks up millions in private jet expenses
content: Kamala Harris' presidential campaign is under scrutiny for spending $3.8 million on private jets in six weeks, conflicting with her strong climate action stance. The use of energy-intensive private aviation raises questions about her commitment to reducing emissions, despite the Biden-Harris administration's ambitious climate goals.
summary: Kamala Harris' presidential campaign is under scrutiny for spending $3.8 million on private jets in six weeks, conflicting with her strong climate action stance. The use of energy-intensive private aviation raises questions about her commitment to reducing emissions, despite the Biden-Harris administration's ambitious climate goals.

title: 'Grimaced': Prince Harry's snide remarks that broke Kate Middleton's heart
content: ​"Meg squeezed some onto her finger and applied it to her lips. Kate grimaced. Small clash of styles, maybe? Something we should've been able to laugh about soon after. But it left a little mark. And then the press sensed something was up and tried to turn it into something bigger. Here we go, I thought sorrowfully," Harry wrote.
summary: ​"Meg squeezed some onto her finger and applied it to her lips. Kate grimaced. Small clash of styles, maybe? Something we should've been able to laugh about soon after. But it left a little mark. And then the press sensed something was up and tried to turn it into something bigger. Here we go, I thought sorrowfully," Harry wrote.

title: Gunshots near Guinea’s presidential palace spark lockdown, force evacuations
content: Gunshots near Guinea’s presidential palace in Conakry led to a military lockdown. Since President Alpha Conde's ousting in 2021 by Colonel Mamadi Doumbouya, the country has faced criticism over transparency and progress. With elections set for 2025, ECOWAS is urging a return to civilian rule while Doumbouya resists foreign intervention.
summary: Gunshots near Guinea’s presidential palace in Conakry led to a military lockdown. Since President Alpha Conde's ousting in 2021 by Colonel Mamadi Doumbouya, the country has faced criticism over transparency and progress. With elections set for 2025, ECOWAS is urging a return to civilian rule while Doumbouya resists foreign intervention.

title: Israeli strikes kill 600, displace 90,000 as Lebanese civilians flee in Desperation
content: Israeli air strikes have forced thousands of Lebanese civilians to flee their homes amid escalating cross-border attacks with Hezbollah. Over 600 lives have been lost in southern Lebanon, displacing 90,000 people. Civilians seek refuge in safer regions like the Bekaa Valley and Mount Lebanon, where local volunteers strive to provide essential aid despite limited resources.
summary: Israeli air strikes have forced thousands of Lebanese civilians to flee their homes amid escalating cross-border attacks with Hezbollah. Over 600 lives have been lost in southern Lebanon, displacing 90,000 people. Civilians seek refuge in safer regions like the Bekaa Valley and Mount Lebanon, where local volunteers strive to provide essential aid despite limited resources.

title: Shootout in Mexico: 11 armed attackers killed in police confrontation
content: A violent confrontation in Nuevo Leon, Mexico resulted in the deaths of 11 armed attackers who targeted a police station in General Teran. State police, the national guard, and the army launched an operation that led to capturing one suspect and seizing six pick-up trucks while pursuing the attackers along a highway near Monterrey.
summary: A violent confrontation in Nuevo Leon, Mexico resulted in the deaths of 11 armed attackers who targeted a police station in General Teran. State police, the national guard, and the army launched an operation that led to capturing one suspect and seizing six pick-up trucks while pursuing the attackers along a highway near Monterrey.

title: 'I don't think...': Elon Musk responds to exclusion from UK international investment summit
content: Elon Musk has been excluded from the UK's International Investment Summit due to his controversial social media posts criticizing UK policies on prison overcrowding. This decision follows last month's Southport riots, where some were jailed for inciting violence online. Officials view his absence as a significant loss for the event aimed at attracting foreign investment.
summary: Elon Musk has been excluded from the UK's International Investment Summit due to his controversial social media posts criticizing UK policies on prison overcrowding. This decision follows last month's Southport riots, where some were jailed for inciting violence online. Officials view his absence as a significant loss for the event aimed at attracting foreign investment.

title: 10-year-olds' reaction to Donald Trump, Kamala Harris viral: 'Liar, pure evil'
content: CNN interviewed 80 elementary school children from Arizona, New Jersey, and Texas to understand their views on presidential candidates Donald Trump and Kamala Harris. Responses included calling Harris a 'liar' and Trump 'pure evil.' Despite differing opinions, most kids supported the idea of having a woman of color as president, CNN said.
summary: CNN interviewed 80 elementary school children from Arizona, New Jersey, and Texas to understand their views on presidential candidates Donald Trump and Kamala Harris. Responses included calling Harris a 'liar' and Trump 'pure evil.' Despite differing opinions, most kids supported the idea of having a woman of color as president, CNN said.

title: Florida cop arrested for intoxicating and 'fooling around' with underage girl
content: A Florida police officer was arrested for allegedly getting an underage girl drunk and engaging in sexual activity with her. The officer met the girl through an app, bought alcohol, and took her to his apartment. He faces multiple charges including lewd conduct and contributing to delinquency of a minor, and has been terminated.
summary: A Florida police officer was arrested for allegedly getting an underage girl drunk and engaging in sexual activity with her. The officer met the girl through an app, bought alcohol, and took her to his apartment. He faces multiple charges including lewd conduct and contributing to delinquency of a minor, and has been terminated.
